text:
(1)
Bryant Park, center and west side, towards 42nd Street, giving a rear view of the Federal Hall replica, on which demolition
is beginning.

April 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same view, but closer to 42nd Street, showing the Park being remodelled under the regime of Commissioner Robert Moses, New York's first city-wide Commissioner of Parks.
March 15, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, seen from the south side, and showing the Park after completion of the work. The flower beds are planted with
ivy.
The large corner building, at Sixth Avenue and 42nd Street, is
the department store of Stern Brothers.
July 6, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Bryant Park

title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Bryant Park

text:
1. Bryant Park, northern side, looking east along 42nd Street, showing tree planting and reconstruction work in the Park. April 30, 1934.

2. The same, later in the year, showing the men cleaning up the
debris. August 20, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Bryant Park

text:
1. Planting trees in the process of remodelling Bryant Park, under the regime of Park Commissioner Robert Moses, showing the northern side of the Park, looking east on 42nd Street. April 30, 1934.

2. The same. April 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Bryant Park

title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Bryant Park

text:
1. Bryant Park, northern side, looking east on 42nd Street, showing reconstruction work in process. March 22, 1934.

2. The same, later in the season. August 20, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
